name: Ouch! Quiz | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is a four letter word that one might say when they get hurt?
questions.explanation:
Ouch.

	When you get hurt, you might say ouch. For instance, when I stubbed my toe this morning, I said "Ouch! That hurt!"

questions.text: Now change a letter to get a word meaning a lot of something, perhaps too many.
questions.explanation:
Much.

	If you have much of something, you have an abundance of it. Perhaps, you might even have too much. For instance, ice cream is good, but if you eat a lot, it can be too much, and you will have a stomachache.

questions.text: Change a letter to find a word that you say to make dogs move while dog sledding.
questions.explanation:
Mush.

	When someone is dog sledding, sometimes they yell 'mush'. That gets the dogs moving. Mush, when pronounced a bit differently (like 'moosh'), can also mean a word describing texture; oatmeal may feel mushy.

questions.text: Change one letter, and you get a word that is something you do to potatoes.
questions.explanation:
Mash.

	If you mash potatoes, you make them mushy by crushing them into a thick goop. That doesn't sound too good, but mashed (or smashed) potatoes really are quite tasty.

questions.text: If you change a letter, you will find a word that is something you might wear on your face to keep it covered.
questions.explanation:
Mask.

	A mask is usually worn so as to hide one's face. Some famous masks include the green one worn by Jim Carrey, the white one worn by the Phantom of the Opera, and the black one worn by Batman.

questions.text: Change a letter, and find a word for what some lizards like to do in the sun.
questions.explanation:
Bask.

	When you see a lizard lying on a rock in the sun, it is basking in the sun. It cannot create its own heat like we can, so it needs to stay warm by basking.

questions.text: Change one letter to find a common fish, like a large-mouth.
questions.explanation:
Bass.

	A bass is a common fish caught by fisherman. Some species are rather small, while others can be huge. Bass, when pronounced differently, can also mean a deep, low sound in music, such as the sound a bass guitar would make,

questions.text: The amount of space taken by an object can be found by changing a letter of the previous answer.
questions.explanation:
Mass.

	The mass of an object is the amount of space that object uses. It is often confused with weight, but the two words mean completely different things.

questions.text: Change a letter to find a word that means you were not able to hit a target.
questions.explanation:
Miss.

	If you try to hit a target, or reach a goal, and do not succeed, you miss your target. Miss is also a word used to describe a young, usually unmarried, woman.

questions.text: Change a word to find something your mom might do to a boo boo to make it better.
questions.explanation:
Kiss.

	When a young child gets hurt, sometimes their mom will kiss it to make it feel better. For instance, when I was little and got a paper cut on my finger, my mom would kiss the boo boo, and it made me feel better.
